Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you cant 51% attack KMD ... because 75% of the blocks are mined by notary nodes.

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: when you say 51% attack KMD, you're referring to the main chain correct?

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: or the assetchain?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: main chain yes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: well... you could 51% attack it, ike with selfish mining but you cant go back past a notarization.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the assetchains are easily attacked, but also you cant reorg a chain past a notarization, Alright has tested this extensivly. it works very well.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: It doesn't take too long to 51% attack an assetchain and then start pissing away hash on your own pointless fork that has no value 😛

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: notaries rock

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: so technically speaking it would be possible to simultaneously attack an altchain and it's assetchain that employs dpow as long as the attack happened within 10 minutes

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: its not an issue so long as the exchanges that are listing the altchain require confirmations greater than 10 minutes

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: got it...

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: it's not counted in minutes but in blocks assuming 1 block a minute yes than it's 10 minutes, but I believe if you rent a lot of hash attack the network the blocks fly faster for a moment.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: You can attack an assetchain, but once you fork from the notary block to try to ds, all you're doing is burning hash on a chain that no one but you will ever follow

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: yeah just saying that there is the possibility of a double spend there

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @shiggidy think of a notary  block as being the same as a hardcoded checkpoint

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: they serve the same function, essentially

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: except that notary blocks keep getting added to the chain, live

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: since attacking an assetchain is relatively easy

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: theoretically

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: hmm theres a 9 block delay

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: between notary blocks

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: if my understanding is correct

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: yes there is the "potential" if proper confirmations are not required (which is why I usually suggest a bit more confirms on an asset than on KMD)

Author: shiggidy#4554
Content: gotcha

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: but the flip side to that is burning yourself on a single ds that gets noticed quickly, so the value is minimal and the risk is higher

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The "gap" is 10 KMD blocks for ACs .

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: they will atempt a notarization 10 KMD blocks after the last one happened.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as long as 2 AC blocks have happened

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: thats not to say that 100% of the time, this occures. The process has a lof of randomness built in and they only happen 80%-90% of the time they are attmepted. This number very recently improved from 50% of the time, due to a bug fix I implemented.

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: Is Cross chain support only for Komodo Assetchains or for other blockchains too like bitcoin/ ethereum?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: gateways CC allows crosschain to bitcoin protocol coins,but requires an oracle CC posting merkle roots

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the tech KMD CC has allows for very largescale new functionality, regardless that GUI are nowhere in sight

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the fundamental problems of crypto are being solved

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is like make a FTL engine that actually goes faster than light, but people saying it has no value since the chairs are uncomfortable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: my focus is achieving the never done before "FTL" type of functions, and NOT on having the right cupholder in the right place with the best upholstery

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I leave such design things to others that are much better at it than me

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and it might take longer to design the perfect cupholder than to invent the "FTL" drive

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but I am confident that it is just a matter of effort and time to have decent cupholders

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but not for those crazy big many liter cups

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: especially since as soon as "the perfect cupholder" exists, someone will invent "the perfect cup" that doesn't fit in it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and then start fud that the FTL drive is worthless due to the cup that doesnt fit into the cupholder

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now, since we have the ability to create the "FTL" tech, we are. but it is still a work in progress for several aspects

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the GUI will come in time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then the marketing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we dont have $75 mil to spend to get placement on a prominent website

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pay for placement in my mind is mostly a waste of money and I dont like to waste money, even if trolls claim that paid placements is marketing, it is not. it is advertising.. which is done after the marketing has already taken effect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: think of marketing as planting the seeds and advertising as harvesting the crop
